data.title: XmlImporter was incorrectly parsing Color hex values (green channel was always zero)
Adding Content Docs
data.body: First pass at the content section and adding some custom effect docs.

data.body: A few simple improvements to MGFX.

data.title: Update GameServiceContainer.cs
data.body:
Added generic overloads for AddService and GetService.
Simpler and cleaner to use, and with the generic GetService there's no need to cast/unbox from object .

data.title: Windows Phone 8.1 SDK
data.body: I use  Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch;   touch = TouchPanel.GetState() and always touch.Count = 0. Why?????

data.title: 2MGFX and MGCB Docs
data.body:
Added sections for 2MGFX and MGCB docs modified from the existing Wiki entries.  Once these are published on the website we will delete the wiki entries and send people to the website instead.

This was also an experiment in a workflow for editing docs.  After creating and pushing a branch up to my fork I completely worked from the GitHub interface to create new MD files and edit existing ones.  I could also edit the config.xml to link in the new MD files.

data.title: Several fixes/improvements to XACT and SoundEngine behavior.
Cannot build latest Windows version
data.body:
After generating the latest develop branch with Protobuild and opening the Windows project, I get the following error:

Error   2   The type or namespace name 'FreeImageAPI' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)  

Ideas?

Seems a new library/reference was added to the Content.Pipeline.Windows project which could not be found in TextureImporter.cs
# if WINDOWS

using FreeImageAPI;
# endif

data.title: Windows GL - No GamerServices?
data.body:
In our autobuild from last night:

error CS0234: The type or namespace name 'GamerServices' does not exist in the namespace 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework' (are you missing an assembly reference?)

Yes, we do a protobuild with every build. Did someone forget to include the GamerServices class in the Windows GL project?

data.title: Change TitleContainer Init back to a static constructor (Other version)
data.body:
Have iOS access TitleContainer.Location so the static constructor is called instead of having an explicit function call.

Fixes #2549

This is an alternate implementation to #2557

data.title: Change TitleContainer Init back to a static constructor
data.body:
We have Have iOS explicitly run the TitleContainer static constructor to ensure it happens on the main thread.

I found out about this method from here:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/4652926
And tested it working on iOS.

Fixes #2549

I have an alternate way of achieving this without using the crazy method, I think I prefer this one though.

This is the follow up task for #1640 & #2488

data.title: Fixed editing Output/IntermediateDir in textbox
data.body: Assigning a path which is already relative to the project no longer causes an exception (was trying and failing to make a URI from an un-rooted path).

data.title: Android: Touch does not disappear from TouchPanel
data.body:
Hi!

sometimes there's a touch event "stuck" in the touch panel, even if there's no finger on it.

It's weird because inside TouchPanelState.Refresh, in the List<TouchLocation> events list, there are some (6 in the case I'm debugging) events with the same Id which does not match the currently checked TouchLocation state. Those events are stuck there and neved removed anymore (they're marked as "moving")

Maybe when there's no event related to one of the _touchState elements, then that _touchState should be removed, isn't it?

Thanks!
Kak

data.title: IntermediateOutputPath issues in Xamarin.Android for VS
data.body:
Is anyone else using latest stable Xamarin.Android in Visual Studio getting the issue where the specified IntermediateOutputPath in the MonoGame csproj is used for some files and not for others?

In Xamarin Studio the same csproj works fine and places all intermediate files in the specified path.

This is the obj tree as it should be created (as it is by Xamarin Studio).  Everything is under Android\AnyCPU\Debug.

```
\---Android
    \---AnyCPU
        \---Debug
            |   MonoGame.Framework.Android.csproj.FileListAbsolute.txt
            |   MonoGame.Framework.dll
            |   MonoGame.Framework.pdb
            |   __AndroidLibraryProjects__.zip
            |
            +---library_project_imports
            |   +---assets
            |   +---bin
            |   +---java
            |   \---res
            \---res
```

This is the tree produced by Visual Studio.  Some files and directories are under Android\AnyCPU\Debug, but the DLL and PDB are placed in Debug.

```
+---Android
|   \---AnyCPU
|       \---Debug
|           |   DesignTimeResolveAssemblyReferencesInput.cache
|           |   MonoGame.Framework.Android.csproj.FileListAbsolute.txt
|           |   __AndroidLibraryProjects__.zip
|           |
|           +---library_project_imports
|           |   +---assets
|           |   +---bin
|           |   +---java
|           |   \---res
|           \---res
\---Debug
    |   MonoGame.Framework.dll
    |   MonoGame.Framework.pdb
    |
    \---TempPE
```

This causes a build error because it can no longer find the DLL because it put it in the wrong spot and then looks in the right spot and can't find it.

data.title: Headline discussion: MonoGame Modularisation
data.body:
**Note, this is a discussion point about the design for separating out XNA namespaces into separate DLL's as a focal discussion point.  Discussions about individual separations  and the work involved should be kept separate.**

Right, following on from the .Net (networking) separation, I thought I'd open up a fresh discussion about moving on from there.  There has been a lot of talk about splitting out the namespaces into separate deliverables (regardless of platform) to ease deliver, management and consumption of the Monogame.Framework.

**A lot of the talk devolved into discussions about platforms or PCL's, this discussion is ONLY for discussing how the breakup should continue from an architectural view, please keep this discussion on target.**

**The XNA Story**
OK, So from XNA's view, their deployment had the following deliverables (as a start point for discussion only) _excluding the already complete .NET separation_
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Avatar.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Touch.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Storage.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Video.dll
- Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Xact.dll

**Initial MonoGame Proposal**
As others have stated on numerous occasions, I also do not feel that MonoGame should go this far.  My gut feel (as a starter for 10) is that we should look towards the following design:
- Monogame.Framework
- MonoGame.Framework.Graphics
- MonoGame.Gramework.Storage

I also have a view that the MonoGame.Framework library should also contain all code that is non-platform specific (no #IFs) but this may need to be considered on a namespace by namespace basis as some may need to be in the separate library to allow for better modularisation or a plugin style approach.

Keep the fight clean and GO.

data.title: TileContainer Initialize should be Public
data.body:
I'm using my own Game implementation. After Changing TileContainer, so Initialization is done via a internal Initialize, I can't use it any more without Reflection!

Would it be possible to change the initialize to public?

data.title: Remove Flags from SetDataOptions
data.body:
Licence and Whitespace got fixed too, it's a tiny file.

This was Flags in XNA3, but no longer in XNA4
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.setdataoptions(v=xnagamestudio.30).aspx
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.setdataoptions(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx

Fixes #2547

data.title: Remove [Flags] From SetDataOptions
data.body:
I suspect that the `SetDataOptions` enum...

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/SetDataOptions.cs

... is not supposed to have the `[Flags]` attribute.  I suspect that is a remnant of XNA3.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.setdataoptions(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx

data.title: MeshHelper.TransformScene is not implemented
data.body:
The content pipeline needs an implementation of [this method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.meshhelper.transformscene.aspx).

Submitters: Please remember MonoGame is unable to accept any submissions based on decompiling XNA.

data.title: Pipeline tool usability
data.body:
Added context menu items: Open File, Open File Location.
Added missing output for several actions: (project) open, close, save, import.
Some improvements to the IView / IController API.
Added application settings for saving/restoring the last window size/location.

data.title: gave default variant to session start to prevent invalid pointer error.
data.body:
fixes a issue with resuming media using sharpdx documented int issue #2330

Pausing and resuming a song raise a SharpDX exception:
"HRESULT: [0x80004003], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_POINTER/Invalid pointer], Message: Invalid pointer"
at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
at SharpDX.MediaFoundation.MediaSession.Start(Nullable guidTimeFormatRef, Nullable varStartPositionRef)
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.Resume()

found that setting the default variant for session start negated the invalid pointer issue.

data.title: Doc Improvements
data.body:
- Lastest SharpDoc generator.
- Page title is now updated.
- Windows 8 Store docs can now be generated.

data.title: BasicEffect Interface Docs
data.body: Moved the docs from BasicEffect to the IEffectFog and IEffectLights as part of a documentation test.  Still need someone to do the rest and fully document BasicEffect, but this is a start.

data.title: DynamicVertexBuffer.SetData() Fix
data.body:
I stumbled across this doing a port of MonoGame to another platform.  I would expect that the SetData() method without the `SetDataOptions` parameter on Xbox 360 would always default to discard.

I don't think it would hurt things and the Windows DirectX version of MonoGame already defaults to discard if the VB is dynamic regardless of the `SetDataOptions` setting.

Any thoughts on this?
